intro: Molina suburvara, commonly known as the subtropical flowering plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a mild aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Molina suburvara is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
